content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a function in Julia that extracts all the Julia code blocks from a Markdown document and returns the combined code as a String:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Split the Markdown document into lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize an empty array to store the Julia code
    julia_code = String[]

    # Iterate through the lines
    i = 1
    while i <= length(lines)
        # Check if the current line is the start of a code block
        if startswith(lines[i], "```julia")
            # Collect the lines of the code block
            code_block = String[]
            i += 1
            while i <= length(lines) && !startswith(lines[i], "```")
                push!(code_block, lines[i])
                i += 1
            end
            i += 1  # Skip the closing code fence

            # Add the collected code to the array
            push!(julia_code, join(code_block, "\n"))
        else
            i += 1
        end
    end

    # Join the code blocks with a newline and return the result
    return join(julia_code, "\n")
end
```
